com.github.fge.filesystem.driver

Class ReadOnlyFileSystemDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.filesystem.driver.ReadOnlyFileSystemDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystemDriver, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public final class ReadOnlyFileSystemDriver
extends Object
implements FileSystemDriver
    A FileSystemDriver composition implementation over another driver for read only filesystems

    This class will delegate all read only operations to the underlying driver and will make all write operations throw a ReadOnlyFileSystemException.

      • isSameFile

        public boolean isSameFile(Path path,
                 Path path2)
                   throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystemDriver
        Tell whether two paths actually refer to the same resource on this filesystem

        Note that this DOES NOT apply to symbolic links, if the filesystem supports them; that is, if path is a symlink to path2, they are not the same file. Also, in spite of the method name, this method can be called on paths which are not regular files but directories, symlinks or others.

        Two paths which are equal are always the same.

        Specified by:
        isSameFile in interface FileSystemDriver
        Parameters:
        path - the first path
        path2 - the second path
        Returns:
        true if and only if both path
        Throws:
        IOException - filesystem level error, or a plain I/O error
        See Also:
        FileSystemProvider.isSameFile(Path, Path)

      • isHidden

        public boolean isHidden(Path path)
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystemDriver
        Tell whether a path is to be considered hidden by this filesystem

        Typically, on Unix systems, it means the last name element of the path starts with a dot (".").

        Specified by:
        isHidden in interface FileSystemDriver
        Parameters:
        path - the path to test
        Returns:
        true if this path is considered hidden
        Throws:
        IOException - filesystem level error, or a plain I/O error
        See Also:
        FileSystemProvider.isHidden(Path)
